desc_content.paragraph: Bases: object
Utility class for Rest based VMAX volume drivers.
This Utility class is for VMAX volume drivers based on Unisphere Rest API.
Add legacy pools to allow extending a volume after upgrade.
Check if volume type have different compression types

list_item.paragraph: is_source_compr_disabled – from source
new_type – from target

desc_content.paragraph: Create a unique short host name under 16 characters.
Helper function for manage volume to get array name and device ID.

list_item.paragraph: volume – volume object from API
external_ref – the existing volume object to be manged

field_body.paragraph: string value of the array name and device ID

desc_content.paragraph: Override ratio if necessary.

The over subscription ratio will be overridden if the user supplied max oversubscription ratio is less than 1. :param max_over_sub_ratio: user supplied over subscription ratio :returns: max_over_sub_ratio
Determine default storage group from extra_specs.

list_item.paragraph: srp_name – the name of the srp on the array
slo – the service level string e.g Bronze
workload – the workload string e.g DSS
is_compression_disabled – flag for disabling compression
is_re – flag for replication

desc_content.paragraph: Returns the short name for a given qualified host name.

Checks the host name to see if it is the fully qualified host name and returns part before the dot. If there is no dot in the host name the full host name is returned. :param host_name: the fully qualified host name :returns: string – the short host_name
Get the default intervals and retries.

list_item.paragraph: interval – Interval in seconds between retries
retries – Retry count

desc_content.paragraph: Create a unique port group name under 12 characters.
Gather necessary replication configuration info.

field_body.paragraph: rep_device_list – the replication device list from cinder.conf

desc_content.paragraph: Given the protocol type, return I for iscsi and F for fc.

field_body.paragraph: string – ‘I’ for iscsi or ‘F’ for fc

desc_content.paragraph: Construct a temporary snapshot name for clone operation.

list_item.paragraph: clone_name – the name of the clone
source_device_id – the source device id

desc_content.paragraph: Get the delta between start and end time.

list_item.paragraph: start_time – the start time
end_time – the end time

desc_content.paragraph: Get volume element name follows naming convention, i.e. ‘OS-UUID’.

field_body.paragraph: volume_id – Openstack volume ID containing uuid
volume element name in format of OS-UUID

desc_content.paragraph: Standard utility for generic volume groups.

list_item.paragraph: group – the generic volume group object to be created
interval – Interval in seconds between retries
retries – Retry count

desc_content.paragraph: Gets the extra specs associated with a volume type.

list_item.paragraph: volume – the volume dictionary
volume_type_id – Optional override for volume.volume_type_id

desc_content.paragraph: Check is compression is to be disabled.
Check if replication is to be enabled.

field_body.paragraph: bool - true if enabled, else false

desc_content.paragraph: Check if a volume has been failed over.
Parses a file and gets array map.
Given a file, parse it to get array and pool(srp).
Truncate a string by taking first and last characters.

list_item.paragraph: str_to_truncate – the string to be truncated
max_num – the maximum number of characters

field_body.paragraph: string – truncated string or original string

desc_content.paragraph: Update the volume_model_updates with admin metadata.

list_item.paragraph: volumes_model_update – List of volume model updates
key – Key to be updated in the admin_metadata
values – Dictionary of values per volume id

desc_content.paragraph: Update extra specs.
Format id and name consistency group.

field_body.paragraph: group – the generic volume group object

desc_content.paragraph: Update the volume model’s status and return it.

list_item.paragraph: volume_model_updates – list of volume model update dicts
volumes – volumes object api
group_id – consistency group id
status – string value reflects the status of the member volume
